intro: Ardisia reynosoi, commonly known as the Ecuadorian beautyberry, is a flowering plant species native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces bright red, berry-like fruits that are an important food source for various bird species. Ardisia reynosoi typically grows as an understory shrub, thriving in humid, shaded environments with well-drained soil. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant in certain regions.
